1-6-1: INAUGURATION:
The date for inauguration for newly elected Municipal officers shall occur at
the first regular or special meeting of the Corporate Authorities of the
Village in the month of May following such election in April. (Ord. 87-O-08, 5-
4-1987)
1-6-2: BOND REQUIREMENTS:
   A.   Bond Required: Before entering upon the duties of their respective
offices, all Village officers, except Trustees of whom no bond shall be
required, shall execute a bond with security to be approved by the Corporate
Authorities of the Village. The bond shall be payable to the Village, unless
otherwise provided by law, in the following sums and conditioned upon the
faithful performance of the duties of their office and the payment of all money
received by such officer, according to law and also the ordinances of the
Village:
 
Village President                                             $50,000.00
Village Administrator                                         500,000.00
Village Clerk                                                 50,000.00
Village Treasurer                                             500,000.00
Village Accountant                                            500,000.00
All other Village officers and employees, whether elected or  10,000.00
appointed, except Trustees, of whom no bond shall be required
 
The bond so required may provide that the obligation of the sureties shall not
extend to any loss sustained by the insolvency, failure or closing of any bank
organized and operating either under the laws of the State or the United States
wherein such officer has placed funds in his custody if the bank has been
approved by the Corporate Authorities as a depository for these funds.
   B.   Type Of Security: Security may be provided either by personal or
corporate surety. If security is provided by a corporate surety, only one
surety shall be required and any company duly authorized to do surety business
in the State shall be sufficient. If security is provided by personal surety,
two (2) sureties shall be required. A personal surety may be any elector
residing within the Village owning property having a value of at least equal to
the amount of the bond. If a bond is executed by a surety or sureties as
provided for in this subsection, the requirement as to the approval of the
Corporate Authorities as to the security of the bond shall have been deemed
satisfied and in such case the bond premium shall be paid by the Village.
   C.   Filing: The bonds hereinbefore provided for shall be filed with the
Village Clerk; except the bond of the Village Clerk, which shall be filed with
the Village Treasurer. (Ord. 2005-O-27, 9-6-2005; amd. Ord. 2023-O-27, 11-7-
2023)
1-6-3: EXPENSES AND COMPENSATION:
   A.   Expenses: All Village officers shall be reimbursed for any out of
pocket expenses incurred in the performance of their duties as Village officers
or while, or in connection with, attending to or carrying out Village business.
   B.   Compensation: The elected Village officers designated herein shall
receive compensation as salaries as fixed from time to time by the Board of
Trustees, as distinguished from the expenses hereinabove provided for.
      1.   Village Trustee:
         a.   Except as otherwise provided below, effective upon the
commencement of their respective terms on or after May 1, 2009, the
compensation of each Trustee of the Village shall be the sum of two hundred
dollars ($200.00) for each regular or special meeting of the Board of Trustees
which he or she attends, and for each regular or special meeting of the
Committee of the Whole of said Board of Trustees which he or she attends, which
compensation shall be paid the following month.
         b.   Effective upon the commencement of their respective terms after
May 1, 2017, the compensation of each Trustee of the Village shall be, and is
fixed at, the sum of two hundred dollars ($200.00) per month, which
compensation shall be paid to each such Trustee every month during the term of
such Trustee.
      2.   Village President:
         a.   Except as otherwise provided below, effective upon the
commencement of the Village President's term on or after May 1, 2009, the
compensation of the Village President shall be, and is fixed at the sum of five
hundred dollars ($500.00) for each regular or special meeting of the Board of
Trustees which he or she attends, and for each regular or special meeting of
the Committee of the Whole of said Board of Trustees which he or she attends,
which compensation shall be paid the following month.
         b.   Effective upon the commencement of the Village President's term
after May 1, 2017, the compensation of the Village President shall be, and is
fixed at, the sum of five hundred dollars ($500.00) per month, which
compensation shall be paid to the Village President each month during the term
of said Village President.
      3.   Compensation Of Employees Generally: Any person or persons employed
by the Village shall be compensated at a level not to exceed that established
by the annual appropriation ordinance then in effect. (Ord. 2016-O-02, 2-3-
2016)
   C.   Payment Of Compensation: All compensation or salaries of all Village
officials and employees shall be paid monthly. The Village Treasurer shall
prepare a payroll list monthly which, when approved by the Board of Trustees,
signed by the Village President and Village Clerk, shall authorize the issuance
of checks for the salaries indicated to be due. (Ord. 2017-O-14, 6-7-2017)
1-6-4: INDEMNIFICATION OF OFFICERS:
   A.   Definitions: As used in this section, the following words and terms
shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection:
    EMPLOYEE: All employees within the Village.
   OFFICER: Any elected or appointed official of the Village.
   B.   Claim Or Action: If any claim or action is instituted against any
present officer or employee or former officer or employee of the Village based
on an injury allegedly arising out of an act or omission occurring within the
scope of his or her employment or official duties as such employee or officer,
the Village shall, to the extent permitted by law:
      1.   Appear and defend against the claim or action; and
      2.   Indemnify the officer or employee or former officer or employee for
his or her attorney fees and court costs incurred in the defense of such claim
or action; and
      3.   Indemnify the officer or employee or former officer or employee for
any judgment based on such claim or action; or
      4.   Indemnify the officer or employee or former officer or employee for
any compromise or settlement of such claim or action if approved in advance by
the Village; provided, however, that the Village shall not indemnify any
officer or employee for any portion of a judgment representing an award of
punitive or exemplary damages.
   C.   No Waiver Of Defenses: Nothing in this section shall be construed as
waiving any defense of the Village or its employees or officers, including, but
not limited to, any defense provided by the Illinois Local Governmental and
Governmental Employees Tort Immunity Act 1  as it may exist from time to time,
in any action brought against the Village or such officer or employee.
   D.   Notice Required: The provisions of this section shall apply only where
the Village has been given notice of any actions brought against any Village
employee or officer, based upon any action of such employee or officer within
the scope of his or her authority as such. Any Village officer or employee
against whom a claim or action is instituted shall notify the Village of such
claim, in writing, within thirty (30) days of service of process upon such
officer or employee. (Ord. 87-O-22, 11-2-1987)
 
Notes
1 1. 745 ILCS 10/1-101 et seq.
1-6-5: VILLAGE ADMINISTRATOR:
   A.   Position Created; Appointment: There is hereby created the position of
Village Administrator who shall be an at-will employee of the Village and who
may be, but shall not be required to be, a Village resident. The Village
Administrator shall be appointed by the Village President, with the advice and
consent of the Board of Trustees. The Village Administrator shall be the Chief
Administrative Officer of the Village under the direction of the Corporate
Authorities. The Village Administrator shall be responsible to and report to
the Village President and Board of Trustees. The Village Administrator shall be
responsible to the Corporate Authorities for the proper administration of all
affairs of the Village, including but not limited to managing, in a timely and
professional manner, the day-to-day operations and business of the Village and
its personnel, preparing written reports and recommendations to the Village
Board, and implementing and enforcing all policies, directives, laws and
ordinances of the Village, excepting such affairs or matters as the Village
President and/or the Board of Trustees may from time to time determine to be
under their direct control and supervision. All provisions herein contained
shall be subject to the exceptions set forth in the immediately preceding
sentence.
   B.   Term, Removal, Compensation: The Village Administrator may be removed
at any time, with or without cause, by the Village President, with the
concurrence of the Board of Trustees. The Village Administrator shall receive
as compensation a monthly salary in such amount as approved by the Village
Board from time to time, plus such bonus(es) as may be determined by the
Village Board from time to time. The fidelity bond of the Village Administrator
shall be in the amount determined by the Village Board.
   C.   Acting Administrator: In the event of the temporary absence or
disability of the Village Administrator, or in the event the position becomes
vacant for any reason, the Village President may act as Administrator or may
appoint an Acting Village Administrator who shall serve until the Administrator
returns to his or her duties or until a regular appointment of a successor is
made.
   D.   Expenditure Authority: The Village Administrator shall be and is hereby
authorized to engage the services of the Village Attorney(s), Village Engineer
(s), or other consultants, and to make purchases of material, equipment,
services or supplies and other expenditures authorized by the annual
appropriation ordinance then in effect, provided that each such purchase or
expenditure or matter that will create an obligation in excess of ten thousand
dollars ($10,000.00) shall first be authorized by the Corporate Authorities,
unless otherwise specifically provided by said Corporate Authorities.
   E.   Duties, Responsibilities, And Powers: The Village Administrator shall
be responsible to perform certain duties and responsibilities on behalf of the
Village in a professional and timely manner, including but not limited to the
following:
      1.   Administer and enforce all policies, directives, laws, and
ordinances adopted by the Corporate Authorities;
      2.   Act as the Village's Chief Administrative Officer responsible for
managing the day to day administrative operations and business of the Village
based on the Corporate Authorities' direction, as well as Village personnel,
preparing written reports and recommendations to the Village Board, and
implementing and enforcing all policies, directives, laws and ordinances of the
Village;
      3.   Administer and enforce Village rules, policies, and procedures
relative to Village personnel, including but not limited to those contained in
the Village's Employee Policy Manual, as may be amended from time to time, and
in accordance with Village Board directives, and recommend to the Corporate
Authorities of the Village the hiring of and/or the removal of employees of the
Village, subject to approval by the Corporate Authorities, and provide
recommendations relative to salary, benefits, discipline, job duties, and staff
development;
      4.   Develop and maintain effective working relationships with Village
staff, Village officials, and Village residents, and provide proper and
appropriate guidance and leadership to Village employees and the Village Board;
      5.   Provide leadership and direction to employees and independent
contractors engaged by the Village, evaluating their performance and
compensation on an annual basis, and on not less than an annual basis,
providing to the Board of Trustees a written evaluation of and recommendation
for any revised compensation levels, and/or any suggested disciplinary action,
for all Village staff;
      6.   Work closely with the Village's Plan Commission and Zoning Board of
Appeals relative to issues pertaining to land use and building development, and
attending the meetings of such public bodies, or delegating to Village staff
members the attendance thereof;
      7.   Oversee and monitor compliance of Village residents with building,
subdivision and zoning ordinances;
      8.   Act as the Village's Code Enforcement Officer and ensure that all
Code enforcement issues are addressed;
      9.   Act as the Village's Emergency Services Disaster Agency (ESDA)
Coordinator to ensure the safety of Village staff and residents;
      10.   Oversee marketing and public relations matters relating to Village
services, activities, events, and programs. Ensure communication consultant and
select employees follow through on strategic public relations goals, including
managing the Village's brand;
      11.   Manage and oversee the production and delivery of the quarterly
Village newsletter;
      12.   Recommend creative solutions for advancing the Village's mission,
improving and streamlining Village services, maintaining the quality of life
and well-being of residents;
      13.   Ensure the proper administration and management of all Village
affairs and maintain the high customer service standards;
      14.   Oversee Village property and grounds, including the Village
Municipal Center (i.e., the Village Hall), Freier Farm, and Fetherling Park to
ensure that such Village property is maintained in neat, clean, sanitary, safe,
and proper operating condition;
      15.   Serve as the point of contact on all legal matters pertaining to
the Village and work closely with the Village Attorney to ensure a proper
resolution of Village and personnel matters;
      16.   Perform routine maintenance of the Village Hall and grounds as
skills allow and engage the services of appropriate contractors when needed to
perform other specialized tasks for the proper maintenance of Village property;
      17.   Maintain confidentiality relative to sensitive information and
Village matters;
      18.   Accurately interpret and apply administrative philosophies of the
Village and clearly communicate such information to Village officials and the
general public;
      19.   Work with the Village Treasurer and Village Accountant relative to,
and be responsible for the preparation of the Village's annual operation and
capital improvement budgets and submit them, together with the Village
Administrator's recommendations relative thereto, to the Corporate Authorities
for their review and approval, and oversee the administration and execution of
the annual Village budget and financial planning processes, including the
annual operation and capital improvement budgets for all Municipal departments,
including but not limited to the monitoring of all Village expenditures,
revenues, and fund transfers;
      20.   Prepare the Village's annual budget and its annual appropriations
ordinance and be responsible for the administration and implementation of such
budget and such appropriations ordinance;
      21.   Prepare the annual tax levy ordinance;
      22.   Facilitate annual financial and strategic planning processes via
the Village's Capital Improvements Program and Financial Plan;
      23.   Recommend capital improvements;
      24.   Recommend ordinances deemed necessary, expedient, and/or in the
best interests of the Village and its residents;
      25.   Make, in the ordinary course of business, all purchases of
services, equipment, material and supplies necessary for the Village as
provided for in the annual appropriations ordinance, provided that all
expenditures shall be submitted for payment to the Corporate Authorities,
except as otherwise provided by this Code or by the Corporate Authorities;
      26.   Prepare long range capital expenditure programs for the Village for
consideration and approval in concept by the Corporate Authorities;
      27.   Recommend to the Corporate Authorities the adoption of such
measures as may be deemed necessary or expedient for the health, safety or
welfare of the community, or for the improvement of the services rendered by
the Village when such measures require action by the Corporate Authorities;
      28.   Furnish the Corporate Authorities with such background support
information as may be requested on any subject to enable them to make decision
(s), and keep the Village Board apprised of Village issues through regular
communication, providing advice on current Village issues, conditions and
requirements;
      29.   Oversee and manage the preparation of Board meeting agendas and
packets, attend all regular and special meetings of the Corporate Authorities,
and take part in the discussion(s) of all matters coming before them, making
recommendations based upon such discussions;
      30.   Attend meetings of the Village committees, commissions, and boards
as necessary;
      31.   Be responsible for, handle in an effective, professional, and
courteous manner, and investigate all public inquiries and complaints received
in relation to matters concerning the administration of the Village and the
services provided by the Village, and direct communications activities to keep
the public informed of Village plans, activities and operations;
      32.   Track and report on County, State and Federal legislation that
could impact the Village and provide recommendations for addressing issues;
      33.   Assist the Village President and Board of Trustees on special
projects;
      34.   Village infrastructure and other capital projects:
         a.   Initiate and oversee planning, engineering and construction for
Village special service areas;
         b.   Oversee the operations of the Village water and sewer systems;
         c.   Prepare special reports regarding Municipal water and sewer
systems as requested by the Village President and Board of Trustees;
         d.   Oversee the Village's road improvement, drainage, and eco-
restoration projects;
         e.   Develop and maintain ongoing working knowledge of critical
components of infrastructure projects.
      35.   Community service:
         a.   Serve as Village representative in the community, including
attending local, regional, State events, meetings, and conferences, including
but not limited to the Lake County Council of Mayors, the Lake County Municipal
League, the Barrington Chamber of Commerce, Flint Creek/Spring Creek Watershed
Partnership, and the Barrington Area Council of Governments;
         b.   Stay abreast of matters of interest to the Village;
         c.   Be approachable to the residents, the stakeholders of our
community.
      36.   Provide the necessary time for and perform such tasks and/or
duties, and exercise all powers delegated to him or her by ordinances of this
Village; by the Village President and/or by the Board of Trustees; and/or by
Corporate Authorities of the Village as required to complete any of the
foregoing tasks and/or duties and to perform such other duties as requested and
properly assigned to him or her by the Village President and/or by the Board of
Trustees from time to time;
      37.   Perform all duties and exercise all powers delegated to him or her
by the Village President and/or by the Board of Trustees;
      38.   Negotiate contracts on behalf of the Village, including contracts
for garbage and recycling services, police services, road maintenance, and snow
removal and ice control, and other contracts, and present recommendations for
such contracts to the Village Board for their consideration and approval.
   F.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017; amd. Ord. 2018-O-24, 11-13-2018; Ord.
2023-O-02, 1-3-2023)
1-6-6: VILLAGE CLERK/EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT AND BUILDING PERMIT ADMINISTRATOR/
DEPUTY VILLAGE CLERK:
   A.   Village Clerk/Executive Assistant:
      1.   Duties Generally: The duties of the Village Clerk/Executive
Assistant shall be those duties as provided by Illinois Statutes or such duties
as may be provided by this Code or other ordinances of this Village, and such
duties as may be assigned by the Village President and/or Board of Trustees to
serve the residents of the Village by assisting the Village Administrator and
Village Board in performing day-to-day duties of the Village Clerk, customer
service, communication, and administrative operations in a professional,
timely, efficient, and accurate manner, and the Village Clerk/Executive
Assistant shall carry out the combined duties as described herein, and such
other duties as may be properly assigned to him or her by the Village
Administrator, all under the supervision of the Village Administrator.
      2.   Appointment: The Village Clerk/Executive Assistant shall be an at-
will employee of the Village appointed by the Village President, with the
concurrence of the Board of Trustees and shall serve under the supervision,
direction and control of the Village Administrator and shall also serve as
Executive Assistant to the Village Administrator. The Village Clerk/Executive
Assistant may be, but shall not be required to be, a Village resident. (Ord.
2017-O-19, 9-5-2017)
      3.   Compensation: The Village Clerk/Executive Assistant shall receive as
compensation such salary as determined by the Board of Trustees from time to
time. (Ord. 2018-O-11, 6-6-2018)
      4.   Removal: Any person holding such Office of Village Clerk and the
related position of Executive Assistant may be removed from office at any time,
with or without cause, by the Village President, with the concurrence of the
Board of Trustees.
      5.   Specific Duties And Responsibilities: The duties and
responsibilities of the Village Clerk/Executive Assistant shall include, but
shall not be limited to, the following:
         a.   Serve as the official keeper of the records for the Village and
maintain a complete and accurate record of Village Board meeting and Committee
of the Whole meeting proceedings;
         b.   Provide administrative support to the Village Administrator and
the Village Board of Trustees for Village- related matters, including
disseminating important Village information;
         c.   Prepare, compile, and distribute materials, including agendas and
corresponding supporting documents for meetings of the Village Board;
         d.   Coordinate court reporter services, as required, serve as notary
public, and handle the coordination of certificates of liability insurance;
         e.   Prepare and file necessary statutory reports, oversee fiscal-year
scheduling requirements and a tentative calendar relative to appropriate and
tax levy matters, prevailing wage rates, sale of volume cap bonds, and track
letters of credit;
         f.   Post and/or publish as needed public meeting notices in
accordance with the Open Meetings Act and other statutory requirements;
         g.   Take minutes for Village Board and Committee of the Whole
meetings and other assigned meetings, and prepare minutes of such meetings for
approval by the Village Board and/or by the Committee of the Whole, as the case
may be;
         h.   Maintain official Village files relative to minutes and various
agendas;
         i.   Serve as the Village's primary Freedom of Information Act
("FOIA") Officer, process FOIA requests on a timely basis in compliance with
Illinois Statutes, and oversee FOIA compliance by other Village staff members;
         j.   Maintain custody of the Village Seal, file Oaths of Office, and
post and publish written notification(s) of public hearings;
         k.   Assist petitioners through the planning and zoning processes, as
requested by the Village's Administrator;
         l.   Perform, assist applicants, and handle the licensing processes
for obtaining liquor, food, business, massage establishment, and amusement
device licenses from the Village, including processing of applications, mailing
of annual renewal letters and license forms and applications, as well as serve
as liaison to various law enforcement agencies and the Illinois Liquor
Commission to process background checks of applicants and assure compliance
with the Illinois Liquor Code and this Code;
         m.   Handle the annual business license renewal process (March/April)
by confirming businesses in the business park with building owners, send out
business license renewal forms and invoices, and keep track of the status of
the Village's licensing of businesses located within the Village;
         n.   Oversee Village elections, provide election packets to
candidates, publish legal notices, certify candidates, file completed candidate
forms with Lake County, and serve as Deputy Registrar to register citizens to
vote;
         o.   Assist in the preparation of the Village newsletter and bulletin,
and update the official Village website relative to the posting of legal
notices, agendas, and approved minutes;
         p.   Assist with the day-to-day administrative operations of the
Village, including ordering and/or picking up office supplies, ensuring Village
equipment is operational, and work with vendors and/or Village staff to keep
the Village office and Municipal Center clean and well maintained;
         q.   Serve as customer service lead and assist with answering and
directing telephone calls, greeting visitors, processing complaints, assist the
public with the building permit application process, vehicle stickers, and yard
waste stickers, mail, and assist the public with and keep a calendar of all
reservations of Village facilities;
         r.   Assist the Village Administrator with special projects, including
meeting recording, Tree City/Arbor Day, and planning and executing of various
community events; and
         s.   Perform other duties as properly assigned by the Village
Administrator and Village Board of Trustees.
      6.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus.
   B.   Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk:
      1.   Position Created; General Duties: There is hereby created the
position of Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk who shall be an
at-will employee of the Village and shall serve the residents of the Village of
Lake Barrington by assisting the Village Administrator and acting as liaison
with the Plan Commission and Zoning Board of Appeals in managing the day-to-day
responsibilities for building, zoning, planning, and other activities relative
to land use in the Village as well as implementing zoning regulations, building
codes, planning guidelines, and permit issuance in a professional, efficient,
timely, and accurate manner. Additionally, the person holding this position of
employment with the Village serves in the Office of Deputy Village Clerk to
assist the Village Clerk with select duties. The person holding this position
of employment shall be subject, as an employee, to hiring and termination by
the Village President. Such employee may be, but need not be, a resident of the
Village to hold the Office of Deputy Village Clerk. Such Deputy Village Clerk
shall have the power and duty to execute all documents required by law or
ordinance to be executed by the Village Clerk and affix the Seal of the Village
thereto, whenever required during any unavailability of the Village Clerk or
whenever such powers and duties have been so delegated by the Village Clerk.
      2.   Signing Documents: When signing any documents, the Deputy Village
Clerk shall sign the name of the Village Clerk followed by the word "by" and
the Deputy Village Clerk's own name and the words "Deputy Village Clerk".
      3.   Specific Duties And Responsibilities: The powers and duties herein
described shall be exercised by such Building Permit Administrator in a
professional and timely manner, which duties and responsibilities shall include
but not be limited to the following:
         a.   Oversee and coordinate building plan review and inspection
services with select vendors, ensuring that the public has access to the
requisite building forms, applications, guidelines, and zoning maps;
         b.   Prepare, compile, and distribute materials, including agendas and
corresponding supporting documents for meetings of the Village Plan Commission
and Zoning Board of Appeals;
         c.   Forward copies of blueprints and documents for review, if
required, to the building inspector, engineers, Fire Department, and other
agencies, and track plans;
         d.   Monitor building permits that are near expiration and direct
follow-up status by the building inspector;
         e.   Oversee construction projects from the plan review process
through final occupancy, which includes permit fee calculation, job site plans,
permit issuance after approved plan review, special inspections, spot surveys,
as-builts, and confirm all final inspections and requirements and review file
for certificate of occupancy and bond refund requests;
         f.   Prepare and submit a semi-monthly report to the Township Assessor
with copies of building permits issued;
         g.   Organize and file completed, pending, and under-review building
permits;
         h.   Prepare monthly building permits issue form for the U.S. Census
reporting, and prepare miscellaneous permits issued for Comcast, NICOR, ComEd
utilities for maintenance, repair, and replacements;
         i.   Serve as point-of-contact for Code enforcement issues relating to
building, zoning, and property maintenance;
         j.   Attend and provide information for adjudication hearings relating
to ordinance enforcement, and the administration of the Village Code
Enforcement and Administrative Adjudication System;
         k.   Manage Building and Zoning Department activities, reviews,
inspections, consultants, including responding to correspondence, files,
reports, etc.;
         l.   Participate in the development of policies and procedures to
ensure the Village's programs reflect the best use of allocated departmental
funds;
         m.   Serve as the point of contact for State Fire Marshal's Office as
the registered elevator/conveyance coordinator for the Village and monitor
inspections conducted semi-annually by the Village's contracted elevator
inspector;
         n.   Act as liaison with outside agencies, consultants, Barrington
Countryside Fire Protection District, Wauconda Fire Department, Cuba Township,
Lake County Health Department, Gewalt-Hamilton engineering, and the Village of
Fox River Grove for water and sewer building issues in the Industrial Park;
         o.   Serve as point of contact relating to drainage complaints and
refer to the Village Administrator or Village Engineer, Cuba Township Road
District, or the Village Roads Committee Chairperson;
         p.   Act as liaison with IDOT and LCDOT for numerous items, including
road problems, dead animal pickups, right-of-way issues, signs, etc., and ComEd
relating to street light maintenance;
         q.   Ensure all work is conducted within budgetary constraints and
according to Village policies, ordinances, codes, and standards of quality;
         r.   Assist with coordinating work and develop plans and strategies by
attending meetings with various personnel, contractors, and associations;
         s.   Ensure that the Village has current copies of all applicable
building codes, amendments, Federal, State and County regulations on file;
         t.   Handle tree removal permit applications and serve as point of
contact to refer issues to the Village Administrator and/or Village Forester;
         u.   Handle all resident complaints relating to garbage pickup and
recycling;
         v.   Serve as point of contact for new businesses for zoning
regulations and building regulations applicable within the M, B, and O Zoning
Districts;
         w.   Assist the Village Clerk with processing Freedom of Information
Act ("FOIA") requests and oversee FOIA compliance by other staff members;
         x.   Assist the Village Clerk with performing liquor, food, business,
massage establishment, and amusement device licensing, including processing of
applications, mailing of annual renewal letters and license forms, as well as
serve as liaison to various law enforcement agencies and the Illinois Liquor
Commissioner to process background checks and assure compliance with the
Illinois State Liquor Code;
         y.   Work closely with Barrington and Wauconda Fire Departments for
HAZMAT annual inspection and liquor license inspections;
         z.   Assist the Village Clerk with overseeing Village elections,
providing election packets to candidates, publish legal notices, certifying
candidates, filing completed candidate forms with Lake County, and serve as
Deputy Registrar to register citizens to vote, when required;
         aa.   Serve as backup for preparing the Village newsletter and
bulletin and update the official Village website relative to posting of legal
notices, agendas, and approved minutes;
         bb.   Serve as backup for answering and directing telephone calls,
greeting visitors, processing complaints, sorting the mail, and booking room
reservations;
         cc.   Notarize documents for the public and Village documents as
needed;
         dd.   Maintain Building and Zoning Department records and dispose of
records approved by the State for disposal;
         ee.   Assist the Village Administrator with special projects; and
         ff.   Perform other duties as properly assigned by the Village
Administrator.
      4.   Authority; Power: The Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village
Clerk shall have the authority and power herein described and such further
power and authority as may be provided by Illinois Statute.
      5.   Custody Of Documents: The Building Permit Administrator/Deputy
Village Clerk, acting on behalf of the Village Clerk, shall be the custodian of
all documents belonging to the Village which are not assigned to the custody of
some other officer.
      6.   Additional Duties: In addition to the duties herein provided, the
Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk shall perform such other
duties and functions as may be required by Illinois Statutes, as required by
Village ordinances, and/or as otherwise assigned by the Board of Trustees.
      7.   Minutes: The Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk,
when acting on behalf of the Village Clerk, shall keep and prepare the minutes
or record of proceedings of all meetings of the Board of Trustees, the Plan
Commission and the Zoning Board of Appeals. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017)
      8.   Compensation:
         a.   The Building Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk shall
receive as compensation such salary as determined by the Board of Trustees from
time to time. (Ord. 2018-O-11, 6-6-2018)
         b.   There shall be no separate compensation paid to the Building
Permit Administrator/Deputy Village Clerk for the duties of Deputy Village
Clerk unless and until such time as this subsection is amended to provide
otherwise.
      9.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017)
1-6-7: VILLAGE TREASURER:
   A.   Appointment And Term: There is hereby created the Office of Village
Treasurer who shall be the Chief Financial Officer of the Village, with the
responsibility for managing the revenue and cash flow of the Village, banking,
collection, receipt, reporting, custody, investment or disbursement of
Municipal funds. The Village Treasurer shall serve at the pleasure of and be
appointed by the Village President by and with the consent of the Board of
Trustees and the Village Treasurer's term of office shall be of an indefinite
term until his or her successor has been appointed and has qualified, provided,
however, any person holding such office may be removed from office at any time,
with or without cause, whether or not his or her term has expired, by the
Village President, with the concurrence of the Board of Trustees.
   B.   Salary And Bond:
      1.   Salary: The Village Treasurer shall receive compensation in an
amount as determined by the Board of Trustees from time to time.
      2.   Bond: Before entering upon the duties of the Treasurer's Office, the
Village Treasurer shall execute a bond conditioned upon the faithful
performance of the Treasurer's duties with security to be approved by the
President and Board of Trustees.
   C.   Duties Of Village Treasurer: The Village Treasurer shall:
      1.   Serve as the Chief Financial Officer of the Village and receive all
monies due to the Village and keep books and accounts in the manner prescribed
by law relating to all Village financial matters, including banking and
investment accounts. Maintain oversight of the Village's outstanding debt
service. These books and accounts shall always be subject to the inspection of
any member of the Corporate Authorities.
      2.   Keep a separate account of each fund or appropriation and the debts
and credits belonging thereto.
      3.   Assure every person paying money into the Treasury receives a
receipt for same, specifying the date of payment and upon what account paid.
The Village Treasurer shall file copies of these receipts with the Village
Clerk with his or her monthly reports. Make or oversee deposits of cash into
the appropriate Village depositories. Responsible for periodic review of
deposit records.
      4.   Work closely with the Village Accountant and Village Administrator
by signing off on and approving accounts payable invoices and signing all
accounts payable checks. The Village Administrator must counter-sign all checks
greater than ten thousand dollars ($10,000.00).
      5.   Oversee and support the preparation of W-2s for employees and 1099s
for vendors by the statutorily mandated date and sign all required documents to
be submitted to the Internal Revenue Service ("IRS").
      6.   Oversee the preparation and processing of payroll information,
including data relative to taxes, Social Security, and other deductions. Review
and approve paychecks, earning statements, monthly, quarterly, and annual State
and federal payroll reports. Prepare and file quarterly payroll tax returns,
including federal tax, Social Security, Medicare, Illinois tax, and
unemployment tax.
      7.   Collaborate with the Village Accountant to ensure that the requisite
total compensation information for the Village staff is accurate and posted
onto the Village's website in accordance with Illinois statutory compensation
disclosure requirements (Public Act 97-0609).
      8.   If the Treasurer has in his or her possession money properly
appropriated to the payment of any warrant lawfully drawn upon the Treasury,
the Treasurer shall pay the money specified in this warrant to the person
designated by the warrant.
      9.   Work closely with the Village Accountant and Village Administrator
in the preparation and oversight of the Village budget, Annual Appropriation
Ordinance, Annual Tax Levy, Annual Audit, Annual Treasurer's Report for filing
with the Village Clerk and publication in the local newspaper and year-end
closing activities. Write year-end financial summary and budget text for the
annual financial plan. Annually review Village fiscal policies along with the
Village Administrator and make recommendations for adjustments as appropriate
for the Board of Trustees.
      10.   Prepare reports, at frequency in accordance with Village Board
requirements, with a full and detailed account of all receipts and expenditures
of the Village. Present reports at Village Board meetings and file the reports
with the Village Clerk within 30 days following the end of the fiscal year.
      11.   Regularly advise the Village Board on matters relating to Municipal
finance.
      12.   Prepare and present an annual investment strategy report to the
Village Board, which includes recommendations for investment and banking
decisions.
      13.   Render an account under oath every month or more often depending on
requirements, demonstrating the state of the Village Treasury at the date of
the account and the balance of money received into the Village Treasury.
      14.   Keep all funds and money in custody that belongs to the Village in
such places of deposit as authorized by the Village Board.
      15.   Review all Village bank statements and ensure reconciliation of
statements.
      16.   Keep track of and monitor vacation, sick, and personal days for
employees of the Village and ensure an annual reconciliation of all time-off
and/or leave benefits.
      17.   Participate in annual insurance, audit, and budget meetings and
provide financial insight relating to the impact of Village decisions.
      18.   Work closely with the Village Accountant to provide oversite and
review of the Village's external auditors throughout the year and coordinate
with the Village Accountant to work with and provide information to the
auditors during the annual audit process.
      19.   Serve as the Illinois Municipal Retirement Fund ("IMRF") agent for
the Village and ensure the accuracy of all funds deposited into the Village's
IMRF accounts. Serve as the primary point of contact with any sales tax rebate
agreements to ensure proper compliance with each agreement. Prepare annual
calculations and approve payments to the respective intended businesses.
      20.   Prepare and review the requisite annual Municipal bond report
(EMMA) and present report to the Village Board on an annual basis.
      21.   Review and respond to reports from the Illinois Department of
Revenue relative to any new businesses and discontinued businesses.
      22.   Prepare a confidential Sales-Tax-by-business category spreadsheet
on a quarterly basis based upon data received from the Illinois Department of
Revenue.
      23.   Attend monthly Village Board meetings and make all necessary and/or
requested presentations to the Village Board.
      24.   Assist the Village Administrator and Village Board on special
projects, as requested from time to time. Working with the Village
Administrator and Accountant, prepare a risk assessment document every two (2)
years with a focus on internal controls and ensure sign-off by Village staff.
      25.   Working with Village Administrator, handle filing of Illinois
Municipal League Risk Management Association (IMLRMA) claims for coverage and
review annual coverages for Village properties and confirm values.
      26.   Handle certain Human Resources ("HR") functions, including
analyzing employee data for insurance plan and making recommendations for
employee cost-sharing relating to medical and dental benefits. Periodically
meet with the insurance broker to discuss employee benefits and rate structures
for the Village.
      27.   Perform other duties as properly assigned by the Village President
and/or by the Board of Trustees.
   D.   Monthly Statements, Warrants, Vouchers, Register: At the end of every
month, and more often if required by the Corporate Authorities, the Village
Treasurer shall render an account under oath to the Corporate Authorities, or
to such officer as may be designated by ordinance, showing the state of the
Treasury at the date of the account and the balance of money in the Treasury.
The Treasurer shall accompany the account with a statement of all money
received into the Treasury, and on what account, together with all warrants
redeemed and paid by the Treasurer. On the day the Treasurer renders an
account, these warrants, with all vouchers held by the Treasurer, shall be
delivered to the Village Clerk and filed, together with the account, in the
Clerk's Office. The Treasurer shall return all warrants paid by the Treasurer
marked "paid". The Treasurer shall keep a register of all warrants, which shall
describe each warrant, showing its date, amount and number, the fund from which
paid, the name of the person to whom paid and when paid.
   E.   Deposit Of Funds; Designation Of Bank: The Village Treasurer shall be
required to keep all funds and money in the Treasurer's custody belonging to
the Village in such places of deposit as authorized by the Board of Trustees
from time to time.
   F.   Personal Use Of Funds: The Village Treasurer shall keep all money
belonging to the Village in the Treasurer's custody separate and distinct from
his or her own money, and shall not use, either directly or indirectly, the
Village's money or warrants in the Treasurer's custody for his or her own use
and benefit, or that of any other person. Any violation of this provision shall
subject the Treasurer to immediate removal from office by the Corporate
Authorities, who may declare the Treasurer's Office vacant. In that case, a
successor shall be appointed, and shall hold the Treasurer's Office for the
remainder of the unexpired term of the Treasurer so removed.
   G.   Report And Annual Account: The Village Treasurer shall report to the
Corporate Authorities, as often as they require, a full and detailed account of
all receipts and expenditures of the Village, as shown by the Treasurer's
books, up to the time of the report. Within thirty (30) days following the end
of the fiscal year, the Village Treasurer shall make out and file with the
Village Clerk a full and detailed account of all Village receipts and
expenditures, and of all his or her transactions as Treasurer during the
preceding fiscal year and shall show in that account the state of the Treasury
at the close of the fiscal year.
   H.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017; amd. Ord. 2018-O-11, 6-6-2018; Ord.
2023-O-26, 11-7-2023)
1-6-8: VILLAGE COLLECTOR:
   A.   Creation Of Office: The Office of Village Collector (also known as
Municipal Collector) is hereby established. The Village Collector shall not be
required to be a Village resident.
   B.   Appointment: The Village Collector shall be appointed by the Village
President, with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees. Any person
holding the appointive Office of the Village Collector may be removed from
office at any time, with or without cause, by the Village President, with the
concurrence of the Board of Trustees.
   C.   Powers: The Village Collector shall have and is hereby vested with all
the rights, powers, privileges, authority and duties authorized and provided
for in the Illinois Municipal Code with respect to the Office of Municipal
Collector in the conduct of his or her office.
   D.   Compensation: There shall be no compensation paid to the Village
Collector unless and until such time as this subsection is amended to provide
otherwise.
   E.   Ex-Officio Village Collector: If there is no Village Collector who has
been appointed by the Village President, the Village Clerk shall serve as the
Ex-Officio Village Collector.
   F.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017)
1-6-9: VILLAGE ENGINEER:
   A.   Office Created: The position of Village Engineer is hereby created.
(Ord. 64-O-67, 6-2-1964; amd. 1996 Code)
   B.   Appointment: The Village Engineer shall be appointed by the Village
President with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees from time to
time. The Village Engineer may be removed at any time, with or without cause,
by the Village President, with the concurrence of the Board of Trustees. The
Village Engineer so engaged may also be utilized on a consulting basis for the
purpose of handling specific projects of the Village. (Ord. 97-O-04, 2-4-1997)
   C.   Compensation: The compensation of the Village Engineer as an
independent contractor shall be as approved by the Board of Trustees from time
to time. (Ord. 64-O-67, 6-2-1964; amd. 1996 Code)
1-6-10: VILLAGE ATTORNEY:
   A.   Office Created: The position of Village Attorney is hereby created.
   B.   Appointment: The Village Attorney shall be appointed by the Village
President with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees from time to
time. The Village Attorney may be removed at any time, with or without cause,
by the Village President, with the concurrence of the Board of Trustees.
   C.   Compensation: The compensation of the Village Attorney as an
independent contractor shall be as approved by the Board of Trustees from time
to time. (Ord. 97-O-04, 2-4-1997)
1-6-11: VILLAGE ACCOUNTANT:
   A.   Position Created: There is hereby created an at-will position of
employment with the Village of Village Accountant, who shall be hired by the
Village President and shall have such duties as assigned by the Village
President, or as delegated or assigned by the Village Administrator. The
Village Accountant shall serve the residents of the Village by assisting the
Village Administrator in performing in a timely and professional manner, a
variety of professional accounting duties associated with preparing,
maintaining, analyzing, verifying, calculating, posting, reconciling, and
balancing complex financial transactions, statements, records, and reports.
   B.   Termination: The Village Accountant shall be an at-will employee of the
Village and may be terminated at any time, with or without cause, by the
Village President.
   C.   Compensation: The Village Accountant shall receive as compensation such
salary as determined by the Board of Trustees from time to time.
   D.   Duties And Responsibilities: The duties and responsibilities of the
Village Accountant shall include, but shall not be limited to, the following:
      1.   Maintain the accuracy of the Village's general and fund ledger and
assist in preparation of the Village budget, annual audit, and year-end closing
activities and perform his or her work independently within approved
guidelines, policies and procedures, which work shall be reviewed through
observation of accomplishments, as well as verification of financial records
and independent audits.
      2.   Review, adjust, and maintain the general ledger, including accounts
payable, payroll, and revenue, journal entries, and maintain accounts for
several individual Village funds, including the Motor Fuel Tax Fund, and
reconcile depository accounts and Motor Fuel Tax Fund.
      3.   Substantiate, process, and deposit all monies coming into the
Village, including all tax revenues, payments for licenses, permits, fines,
bank transfers, and other obligations due the Village, balance daily receipts,
and prepare information for and make deposits, including credit card receipts.
The Village Accountant does not make cash bank deposits.
      4.   Substantiate and process all invoices for payment, resolve problems
with vendors, enter accounts payable information, prepare accounts payable
reports/warrants for the Village Board approval, and prepare, and mail checks
for payment of accounts payable.
      5.   Prepare and process payroll information, including data relative to
taxes, Social Security, and other deductions, and prepare paychecks, earning
statements, monthly, quarterly, and annual State and Federal payroll reports.
Provide necessary information to the Treasurer for filing of the reports.
      6.   Prepare and mail W-2s for employees and 1099s along with require
forms for vendors by the stat   utorily mandated date. Responsible for
collection of vendor form W-9's.
      7.   Prepare requisite compensation information for Village staff and
ensure information is posted on the Village's website in accordance with
Compensation Disclosure - Public Act 97-0609.
      8.   Invoice developers and petitioners for reimbursable expenses, and
invoice businesses and residents for false security system alarms.
      9.   Monitor cash flow, advise the Village Treasurer and the Village
Administrator of funds available for investment and reinvestment.
      10.   Assist Village Treasurer with the preparation of the Village's
annual appropriation ordinance, annual tax levy ordinance, and annual
Treasurer's Report.
      11.   Participate in development of, and monitoring of expenses in
relation to the Village's annual budget and the Appropriation Ordinance.
      12.   Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, as well
as such ad hoc reports for use by the Village Administrator and/or by the
Village Board, as they may request from time to time.
      13.   Report monthly bank balances, monitor and keep track of Fund
Balance and the percentage of Fund Balance on a monthly basis for the Village
Treasurer.
      14.   Working with the Village Treasurer, ensure timely payments of the
debt service on any outstanding Village debt and confirm payment thereof.
      15.   Review water and sewer rates every five (5) years and provide
information for new ordinance, maintaining annual schedules.
      16.   Update various monthly schedules and spreadsheets for Utility Tax
revenues and developer impact fees.
      17.   Reconcile front counter cash drawer and petty cash funds on a
weekly basis and secure excess cash. Ensure smaller bills are available for the
front counter cash fund.
      18.   Prepare and submit annual man-hour report for IMLRMA.
      19.   Work with the Village Treasurer and provide information to the
auditors during the annual audit.
      20.   Interact with Village engineers and Village committees regarding
road work, stormwater and wetland issues, and letters of credit.
      21.   Oversee water and sewer records billing, revenue, cash receipts and
monitor aging reports for Fox River Grove.
      22.   Handle weed liens, bill owners of property for ordinance violations
relating to weed liens, and coordinate with the Village Attorney for
noncompliance payments.
      23.   Monitor outstanding letters of credit and notify Village engineers,
developers, builders, and banks pertaining to initiation, renewals, values, and
balances, and demands in cases of default.
      24.   Conduct weekly backups of the Village's computer system and Tera
Station (shared drive), and several times a week for QuickBooks.
      25.   Assist Village Administrator and Village Board on special projects,
including assisting with coordination of the Annual Barn Stomp.
      26.   Perform other duties as properly assigned by the Village
Administrator.
   E.   Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are
representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform
the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to
enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While
performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit
for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, and feel; reach with
hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to stand
and walk. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty five (35)
pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to
adjust focus. (Ord. 2017-O-19, 9-5-2017; amd. Ord. 2018-O-11, 6-6-2018; Ord.
2023-O-26, 11-7-2023)
1-6-12: EMPLOYEE POLICY MANUAL:
The Employee Policy Manual of the Village, in its amended and restated form is
hereby approved, adopted, and incorporated by reference as if set out herein in
its entirety, effective on December 31, 2023. A copy of said Employee Policy
Manual dated December 31, 2023 is on file in the office of the Village Clerk
for reference and inspection by the public and by employees and officers of the
Village. (Ord. 2018-O-23, 11-13-2018; amd. Ord. 2020-O-03, 1-7-2020; Ord. 2023-
O-01, 1-3-2023; Ord. 2023-O-30, 12-5-2023)
CHAPTER 7
MUNICIPAL BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS
ARTICLE A. PLAN COMMISSION
SECTION:
1-7A-1: Creation
1-7A-2: Membership And Terms
1-7A-3: Meetings
1-7A-4: Powers
1-7A-5: Bond And Salary
1-7A-1: CREATION:
A Plan Commission for the Village of Lake Barrington is hereby created pursuant
to State law 1 . (Ord. 60-O-04, 1-4-1960)
 
Notes
1 1. 65 ILCS 5/11-12-4.
1-7A-2: MEMBERSHIP AND TERMS:
   A.   Membership: The Plan Commission hereby created shall consist of seven
(7) members who shall be appointed by the Village President, with the consent
of the Board of Trustees. One of the members so appointed shall be designated
by the Village President as chairman at the time of his or her appointment. In
addition, the Village President shall be a member ex officio of the Commission.
   B.   Term Of Office: At and upon the effective date of the Ordinance
codified in this Article, two (2) members of the Plan Commission shall have
terms expiring on April 30, 1995; two (2) members of the Plan Commission shall
have terms expiring on April 30, 1996; one member of the Plan Commission shall
have a term expiring on April 30, 1997; one member of the Plan Commission shall
have a term expiring on April 30, 1998; one member of the Plan Commission shall
have a term expiring on April 30, 1999. The length of respective terms of
members of the Plan Commission holding office on the effective date of the
Ordinance codified in this Article, shall be initially determined by the
Village President, consistent with the provision of this subsection. The
successor to each member so appointed shall each serve for a five (5) year
term. All members shall serve until their successors have been appointed and
qualified. Any such member may be removed from office at any time, whether or
not his or her term has expired, by the Village President, by and with the
concurrence of the Board of Trustees. (Ord. 97-O-04, 2-4-1997)
1-7A-3: MEETINGS:
   A.   General:
      1.   The Plan Commission shall hold regular meetings at such times and
places as may be determined by it, and special meetings of the Commission may
be held upon the call of the chairman or of any three (3) members thereof in
the same manner as provided for the calling of special meetings of the Board of
Trustees in subsection 1-5-4C of this Title. The Village Clerk shall act as
secretary of the Plan Commission; provided, however, the chairman of the Plan
Commission may appoint a recording secretary for such term or terms and at such
time or times as the chairman shall determine to keep a record of its
proceedings in an appropriate journal. The recording secretary may either be a
member or a nonmember of the Plan Commission.
      2.   A majority of the full membership of the Plan Commission shall
constitute a quorum to do business and all action of the Commission at which a
quorum is present shall be controlled by a majority vote of those present.
      3.   The chairman shall be the presiding officer of the Commission and
shall be entitled to vote on all matters in the same manner as any other member
of the Commission. (Ord. 78-O-02, 1-7-1978)
   B.   Public Meetings: All official meetings of the Commission shall be open
to the public.
   C.   Rules Of Procedure: The Commission may adopt its own rules of procedure
for the conduct of its meetings but such rules shall not be in conflict with
any of the provisions of this Article or any other ordinances of the Village or
with any applicable statutory requirements. (Ord. 60-O-04, 1-4-1960)
1-7A-4: POWERS:
The Plan Commission shall exercise all the powers conferred and authorized by
State law and this Code, and shall be governed by the provisions of the State
and this Code in determining its purposes, duties and powers. (Ord. 60-O-04, 1-
4-1960; amd. 1996 Code)
1-7A-5: BOND AND SALARY:
No bond shall be required of any member of the Plan Commission and the members
shall serve without salary, provided, however, the Chair of the Plan Commission
shall receive a salary of fifty dollars ($50.00) per month. (Ord. 2018-O-16, 7-
10-2018)
ARTICLE B. ZONING BOARD OF APPEALS
SECTION:
1-7B-1: Creation And Membership
1-7B-2: Meetings
1-7B-3: Jurisdiction
1-7B-4: Vote
1-7B-1: CREATION AND MEMBERSHIP:
   A.   Board Created: A Board of Appeals is hereby created. The word "Board"
when used in this Article shall be construed to mean the Board of Appeals.
   B.   Appointment: The said Board shall consist of seven (7) members
appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Board of Trustees
of the Village.
   C.   Term: The members of said Board shall serve respectively for the
following terms: one for one year, one for two (2) years, one for three (3)
years, one for four (4) years, one for five (5) years, one for six (6) years,
and one for seven (7) years; the successor to each member so appointed to serve
for a term of five (5) years.
   D.   Chairman: One of the members so appointed shall be named as chairman at
the time of his appointment.
   E.   Removal: The Village President, with the concurrence of the Board of
Trustees, shall have the power to remove any member of said Board for cause and
after a public hearing.
   F.   Vacancies: Vacancies upon said Board shall be filled for the unexpired
term of the member whose place has become vacant in the manner herein provided
for the appointment of such member. (Ord. 97-O-04, 2-4-1997)
1-7B-2: MEETINGS:
   A.   Call Of Meetings: The meetings of the Board of Appeals shall be held at
the call of the chairman or at such times as such Board may determine.
   B.   Administration Of Oaths; Attendance By Witnesses: Such chairman, or in
his absence, the acting chairman, may administer oaths and compel the
attendance of witnesses.
   C.   Open To Public: All meetings of said Board shall be open to the public.
   D.   Minutes; Records: The Board shall keep minutes of its proceedings,
showing the vote of each member upon every question, or if absent or failing to
vote indicating such fact, and shall also keep records of its examinations and
other official actions. (1996 Code)
1-7B-3: JURISDICTION:
The Board of Appeals is hereby vested with the powers and duties as provided in
Title 8, Chapter 11 of this Code. (1996 Code)
1-7B-4: VOTE:
The concurring vote of four (4) members of the Board of Appeals shall be
required for any recommendation to the Board of Trustees. (1996 Code)

ETHICS

1-8-1: INTENT:
It is in the interest of the Village and its citizens that all officers of this
Village avoid any conflict of interest and also avoid the appearance of
conflict of interest or other similar improprieties. (Ord. 2021-O-10, 8-3-2021)
1-8-2: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this Chapter, the following terms shall be given these definitions:
BOARD OF      The Board of Trustees of the Village of Lake Barrington.
