2-3-1: PURPOSE:
This chapter is enacted in order to protect the health, safety and welfare of
the people of the Village and to provide standards for the sound and careful
control and regulation of the sale and distribution of alcoholic liquor. (Ord.
93-O-11, 4-22-1993)
2-3-2: DEFINITIONS:
   A.   Except as otherwise defined in this section, words and phrases used in
this chapter shall have the respective meanings ascribed to them in the
Illinois Liquor Control Act 1 . Any reference to "Liquor Control Act" or 235
Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/11, et seq., "chapter 235", "chapter 235 of the
Illinois Compiled Statutes", "Dram Shop Act", "dramshops" or any other similar
reference as used herein shall mean and refer to the Illinois Liquor Control
Act 2 , as amended from time to time.
   B.   For the purposes of this chapter, the term "possess" or "possession"
shall mean: To be within the physical control of a person or within the area of
a person's reasonably expected physical control (i.e., in their constructive
possession), but for the purpose of this chapter, "possession" shall not
include the act of lawfully serving of alcoholic liquor to one or more
customers at tables on the licensed premises by an employee of a licensee of a
Class B, Class C, Class D, Class E, Class F, Class G, Class I, Class K and/or
Class L license issued pursuant to this chapter in the course of their
employment if such employee meets the age and supervision requirements of this
chapter.
   C.   "Bring Your Own Bottle" or "BYOB" shall mean consumption of alcoholic
liquor that was not purchased on the licensed premises.
   D.    "Commission" or "State Commission" shall mean the Illinois Liquor
Control Commission, that executive agency of the State of Illinois which
enforces the Illinois Liquor Control Act 3 .
   E.   "Qualifying Organization": For purposes of this Chapter, the term
"qualifying organization" shall mean a not-for-profit organization which has
been in existence for at least two (2) years, is in good standing with the
Illinois Secretary of State and qualified to do business in the State of
Illinois, and whose purpose and function is providing benefit, assistance or
support to charitable, athletic, religious, youth service, or any civic or
community service programs located within and/or serving the Village, and/or is
a governmental entity.
   F.   "Retail Goods Establishment" shall mean a building, property, or
activity, the principal use or purpose of which is the sale of physical goods,
products, or merchandise directly to the consumer, including food sales. In
order to qualify as a "Retail Goods Establishment", at least fifty percent
(50%) of gross revenues shall be from the sale of physical goods, products,
and/or merchandise directly to customers on premises for which the seller is
obligated by Illinois State law to collect retail sales tax. (Ord. 2018-O-17,
8-7-2018; amd. Ord. 2023-O-15, 6-13-2023; Ord. 2024-O-15, 9-3-2024)
 
Notes
1 1. 235 ILCS 5/1-1 et seq.
2 2. 235 ILCS 5/1-1 et seq.
3 3. 235 ILCS 5/11, et seq.
2-3-3: LOCAL LIQUOR CONTROL COMMISSIONER:
   A.   President To Serve As Commissioner: The President of the Village shall
serve as the Local Liquor Control Commissioner of the Village and shall be
charged with the administration of the provisions of the Liquor Control Act,
235 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/11, et seq., and of this chapter, and of such
other ordinances of the Village relating to alcoholic liquor and/or relating to
the licensed premises as may be enacted by this Village from time to time. The
Village President may appoint a person or persons to serve as a deputy in order
to assist him or her in the exercise of the powers and the performance of the
duties provided for such Local Liquor Control Commissioner.
   B.   Compensation: The Local Liquor Control Commissioner and any deputies
appointed by him or her shall serve without additional compensation for such
duties.
   C.   Powers, Duties And Functions: The Local Liquor Control Commissioner
shall have the following powers, duties and functions with respect to local
liquor licenses:
      1.   To grant and/or suspend for not more than thirty (30) days or revoke
for cause, all local licenses issued to persons or entities for premises within
his or her jurisdiction if he/she determines that the licensee has violated any
provision of the Illinois Liquor Control Act or any valid Village ordinance or
any applicable rule or regulation established by the Illinois Liquor Control
Commission which is not inconsistent with law.
      2.   To adopt rules and regulations for the conduct and operation of a
licensee's business which are not inconsistent with Illinois State law and not
inconsistent with this Code.
      3.   To enter or to authorize any law enforcing officer to enter at any
time upon any premises licensed hereunder to determine whether any of the
provisions of the Illinois State law, this chapter and all other applicable
ordinances of the Village and any rules or regulations adopted by him or her
and by the Illinois Liquor Control Commission have been or are being violated,
and at such time to examine the premises of the licensee in connection
therewith.
      4.   To receive complaints from any citizen within his or her
jurisdiction that any of the provisions of the Illinois State law, of this
chapter and all other applicable ordinances of the Village and of any rules,
regulations, or order(s) adopted by him or her have been or are being violated
and to act upon such complaint in the manner provided by law.
      5.   To cause all local licensee fees to be paid to the Village
Treasurer.
      6.   To examine, or cause to be examined, under oath, any applicant for a
local license or for a renewal thereof, or any licensee upon whom notice of
revocation or suspension has been served, and to examine, or cause to be
examined, the books and records of any such applicant or licensee or
respondent; and to hear testimony and take proof for his or her information in
the performance of his or her duties and for such purposes to issue subpoenas
which shall be effective in any part of this State. For the purpose of
obtaining any of the information desired by the Local Liquor Control
Commissioner under this section, he or she may authorize his or her agent to
act on his or her behalf.
      7.   Notwithstanding anything contained in this chapter to the contrary,
without notice or hearing to order, upon the issuance of a written order
stating the reason for such determination, the Local Liquor Control
Commissioner may order and cause a licensed premises to be closed for not more
than seven (7) days, giving the licensee an opportunity to be heard during that
period, if the Local Liquor Control Commissioner has reason to believe that any
continued operation of a particular licensed premises will immediately threaten
the public health, safety and/or welfare of the community, except that if such
licensee shall also be engaged in the conduct of another business or businesses
on the licensed premises, such order shall not be applicable to such other
business or businesses. (Ord. 2018-O-17, 8-7-2018)
2-3-4: LICENSE REQUIRED; PRORATION OF CERTAIN LICENSE FEES:
   A.   Village and State Licenses Required:
      1.   No person shall sell or offer for sale or possess with intention to
sell at retail in the Village any alcoholic liquor without a retailer's license
from the Village in addition to a license issued by the State of Illinois.
      2.   No person shall sell or offer for sale at retail in the Village any
alcoholic liquor in violation of the terms of conditions of the Village
license, or of the applicable State of Illinois license or in violation of any
provision of this Chapter or any provisions of the Illinois Liquor Control Act.
   B.   Proration of Certain License Fees:
      1.   When an applicant for a Class A, Class B, Class C, Class D, Class F,
Class F.2, Class G, Class H, Class I, Class L, Class M, Class N, and/or Class O
liquor license has not engaged in the business until after the expiration of
part of the current license year, the fee for such a partial license year shall
be prorated by quarters, and the fee paid for each quarter or fraction thereof,
except as otherwise provided by this Chapter, during which the business has
been or will be conducted.
      2.   When any holder of a liquor license issued pursuant to this Chapter
ceases its operation during any license year other than on April 30 of any
license year, there shall be no refund of any portion of the liquor license
fee.
(Ord. 2018-O-17, 8-7-2018; amd. Ord. 2024-O-03, 2-15-2024)
2-3-5: APPLICATION FOR LICENSE:
Applications for licenses required by this chapter shall be made to the
President of the Village and shall be in writing, signed by the applicant, if
an individual, or by a duly authorized agent thereof, if a club or corporation,
verified by oath or affidavit. In order to ensure timely initial issuance and/
or renewal of a liquor license, a complete application for any liquor license
shall be submitted to the Village Clerk by the applicant or his, her, or its
agent(s): a) on or before March 15 of each year for a renewal for the next
license year which begins on the following May 1st; and b) at least sixty (60)
days prior to the proposed initial issuance date for any new liquor license.
Any applicant who does not submit a fully completed application with all
required supporting documents in compliance with the foregoing application
deadline(s) shall be required to pay a ten percent (10%) license fee surcharge
at the time of issuance of the liquor license(s) in question, but such license
fee surcharge may be waived by the Village President, or his or her designee,
upon good cause shown. Each application shall contain and/or be accompanied by
the following information and statements:
   A.   The name, age and address of the applicant in the case of an
individual; in the case of a partnership, each person entitled to share in the
profits thereof; in the case of a limited liability company ("LLC"), each
person entitled to share in the profits and each member and each manager
thereof; and in the case of a corporation for profit or a club, the date of
incorporation, the objects for which it was organized, the names and addresses
of the officers, directors, and registered agent, and each person owning five
percent (5%) or more of the stock of such corporation, and the name and address
of such person(s); and in the case of a club, two (2) copies of a list of names
and residences of its members and sufficient information to prove that it
qualifies as a club pursuant to the provisions of the Illinois Liquor Control
Act, as amended from time to time;
   B.   The citizenship of the applicant, his or her place of birth and, if a
naturalized citizen, the time and place of his or her naturalization;
   C.   The character of business of the applicant; and in the case of a
corporation or an LLC, the objects for which it was formed;
   D.   The length of time that such applicant has been in business of that
character, or in the case of a corporation or an LLC, the date on which it was
incorporated;
   E.   The location and description of the premises or place of business which
is to be operated under such license and sufficient written evidence to
establish the applicant's ownership of the premises proposed to be licensed or
a signed lease between the applicant and the owner(s) of such premises;
   F.   A statement whether the applicant has made application for a similar
license on premises other than described in this application in this Village or
in any other jurisdiction and the disposition of such application;
   G.   A statement that the applicant has never been convicted of a felony and
is not disqualified to receive a license by reason of any matter or thing
contained in this chapter, laws of this State or this Code provision of this
chapter or by reason of any provision of the Illinois Liquor Control Act,
including but not limited to 235 Illinois Compiled Statutes 5/6-2;
   H.   Whether a previous license by any other jurisdiction has been revoked
and the reasons therefor;
   I.   A statement that the applicant will not violate any of the laws of the
State of Illinois, of the United States, or this Code in the conduct of his or
her place of business;
   J.   Written evidence of liquor liability insurance coverage for the
licensee and the licensed premises covering the entire license year, including,
but not limited to, coverage for statutory dramshop claims in the minimum
statutory amounts. (Ord. 2018-O-17, 8-7-2018)
2-3-6: CLASSIFICATION OF LICENSES:
   A.   Class A License:
      1.   Retail Sale In Original Package, Not For Consumption On Premises: A
Class A license shall authorize sale at retail of alcoholic liquor in the
original package but not for consumption on the premises of sale.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail any alcoholic liquor in the original package but not for
consumption on the premises of sale in the Village except on a day of the week
during the period beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending
with the mandatory close time for such day, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Monday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Tuesday     6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Wednesday   6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Thursday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Friday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Saturday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Sunday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
 
      3.   Fee: The original fee for a Class A license shall be as specified
from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. The renewal fee for a Class A license shall be as
specified from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   B.   Class B License:
      1.   Restaurant: A Class B license shall authorize:
         a.   Restaurant/Sale, Serving, And Consumption Of Alcoholic Liquor On
The Premises: A Class B license shall authorize the sale at retail and serving
of alcoholic liquor for consumption on the premises of a restaurant, except as
otherwise permitted either by Section 6-28.8 or by section 6-33 of the Illinois
Liquor Control Act, provided that the primary purpose of and operation of such
facility is use as a restaurant and provided that sales occur only during hours
when the facility is being operated as a restaurant. For purposes of this
section, a "restaurant" shall be defined as any public place, the primary
purpose of which is to be kept, used, maintained, advertised and held out to
the public as a place where meals are regularly served, without sleeping
accommodations, such space being provided with adequate and sanitary kitchen
and dining area equipment and capacity and having employed therein a sufficient
number and kind of employees to prepare, cook, and serve suitable food for its
guests. A "meal" for this purpose means any food and/or beverage that is or may
be served for or as part of breakfast, lunch, brunch, or dinner. A coffee shop
may be considered a "restaurant" if it regularly serves meals.
         b.   Retail Sale In Original Package, Not For Consumption On Premises:
The sale at retail of alcoholic liquor in the original package but not for
consumption on the premises of sale.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail and/or to serve any alcoholic liquor on the licensed
premises of a Class B licensee in the Village except on a day of the week
during the period beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending
with the mandatory close time for such day, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time (On The Next
            Such Day Of Week                Day)

            Such Day Of Week                Day)

from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. The renewal fee for a Class B license shall be as
specified from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   C.   Class C License:
      1.   Golf Club: A Class C license shall authorize:
         a.   Retail Sale, For Consumption On Premises: The sale at retail and
serving of alcoholic liquor for a golf club (public/semipublic/private) only
for consumption on the premises of sale, except as otherwise permitted either
by Section 6-28.8 or by section 6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act,
provided such sale and serving is accessory to the main purpose of operating a
golf club on the premises and provided further that such sale and serving is
accessory to the serving of meals on the premises in conjunction with a
restaurant operation and not from vending machines; and also
         b.   Retail Sale In Original Package, Not For Consumption On Premises:
The sale at retail of alcoholic liquor in the original package but not for
consumption on the premises of sale.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail and it shall be unlawful to serve alcoholic liquor in the
Village except on a day of the week during the period beginning with the
permitted commencement time and ending with the mandatory close time for such
day, as follows:

   D.   Class D License:

shall authorize the sale at retail and serving of beer and wine for consumption
only on the premises of sale, except as otherwise permitted either by Section
6-28.8 or by Section 6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act, provided that the
primary purpose of and operation of such facility is use as a restaurant and
provided that sales occur only during the hours when the facility is being
operated as a restaurant 1 . 
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail and it shall be unlawful to serve beer and wine for
consumption on the premises of sale in the Village except on a day of the week
during the period beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending
with the mandatory close time for such day, as follows:

a related Class F Liquor License if such licenses will be held by a business
establishment that already holds a current and valid Class M Liquor License
issued by the Village, provided, however, this fee waiver shall expire on May
1, 2021.
   E.   Class E License:
      1.   Retail Sale And Serving, Organizations And Lodges: A Class E license
shall authorize the temporary sale at retail and serving of alcoholic liquor on
the premises for which the license is issued, except as otherwise permitted
either by Section 6-28.8 or by section 6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act,
by not-for-profit corporations, including but not limited to clubs,
associations, and/or lodges, when organized for objects and purposes other than
the sale and/or consumption of alcoholic liquor, and other than for commercial
purposes, and organized for at least two (2) years prior to the date of the
application for a license.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail and it shall be unlawful to serve alcoholic liquor for
consumption on the premises of sale in the Village except on a day of the week
during the period beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending
with the mandatory close time for such day, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time (On The Next
            Such Day Of Week                Day)
Monday      11:00 A.M.                      1:00 A.M.
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time (On The Next
            Such Day Of Week                Day)
Monday      11:00 A.M.                      1:00 A.M.
Tuesday     11:00 A.M.                      1:00 A.M.
Wednesday   11:00 A.M.                      1:00 A.M.
Thursday    11:00 A.M.                      1:00 A.M.
Friday      11:00 A.M.                      2:00 A.M.
Saturday    9:00 A.M.                       2:00 A.M.
Sunday      9:00 A.M.                       1:00 A.M.
 
      3.   Number Of Licenses: The number of authorized Class E licenses shall
be unlimited, provided, however, no licensee shall receive more than four (4)
Class E licenses in any twelve (12) month period from May 1 through April 30.
Each application for a Class E license shall be considered as an original
application and not as an application for a renewal license.
      4.   Fee: The fee for a Class E license shall be as specified from time
to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. There shall be no renewal fee for a Class E license.
      5.   Term: The term of Class E licenses shall be for a period of twenty
four (24) hours provided that the license may be extended to a period of time
not to exceed ninety six (96) consecutive hours in the aggregate.
   F.   Class F License:
      1.   Retail Sale And Serving, Outdoor Premises: A Class F license shall
authorize the sale at retail and serving of alcoholic liquor for consumption
only on the premises, except as otherwise permitted either by Section 6-28.8 or
by section 6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act, provided such sale and
serving is accessory to the main purpose of the serving of meals on such
outdoor premises and not a vending machine operation.
      2.   Additional License Required: A Class F license shall only be issued
to a holder of a current and valid license of one of the following types: a
Class B license, a Class C license, or a Class D license.
      3.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail any alcoholic liquor for consumption on the outdoor premises
of sale in the Village except during the periods beginning with the permitted
commencement time and ending with the mandatory close time for the specified
day of the week, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Monday      11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Tuesday     11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Wednesday   11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Thursday    11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Friday      11:00 A.M.                      12:00 midnight
Saturday    9:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Sunday      9:00 A.M.                       10:00 P.M.
 
Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Class F license shall not authorize retail
liquor sales except at those times respectively authorized by the Class B,
Class C, or Class D license to which it relates. (Ord. 2009-O-10, 6-3-2009)
      4.   Fee: The fee for a Class F license shall be as specified from time
to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
      5.   Term: The effective period for any Class F license shall be for the
license year; provided, however, that during the entire term that a Class F
license is in effect, the holder of a Class F license must, at all times during
such term, be the holder of a current and valid Class B, Class C, Class D, or
Class M license. Accordingly, if, for any reason whatsoever, such Class B,
Class C, Class D, or Class M license is revoked, suspended or terminated during
the term of the Class F license, the Class F license, upon the revocation,
suspension or termination of the Class B, Class C, Class D, or Class M license,
shall also be automatically and immediately revoked, suspended or terminated,
as the case may be, without any further action by the Village.
      6.   Definition: As used in this subsection F, "outdoor premises" shall
mean:
         a.   An area immediately adjacent to the main building for which the
Class B, Class C, Class D, or Class M license has been issued where alcoholic
liquor may be served pursuant to a Class F license issued by the Village; and
         b.   Any point within such area shall not be more than one hundred
fifty feet (150') from said main building.
         c.   No part of the outdoor premises shall include any parking lot or
parking area.
      7.   Additional Restrictions: The following shall be applicable with
respect to the outdoor premises:
         a.   The outdoor premises shall be owned or leased, and operated by
the same person to whom the respective Class B, Class C, Class D, or Class M
license has been issued.
         b.   At all times, the outdoor premises shall be used in conjunction
with the operation of the restaurant operation carried on in the main building.
         c.   The outdoor premises shall not block, in any way whatsoever, any
entrance to or exit from the said main building.
         d.   The outdoor premises shall be fully enclosed by a fence so as to
discourage ingress to and egress from the area except through designated
entrances and exits.
         e.   The maximum number of persons allowed at any time in such outdoor
premises shall be seventy five (75).
         f.   Live entertainment shall not be permitted on the outdoor premises
except when specifically approved in advance by the President and Board of
Trustees. Any other type of entertainment provided, such as, but not limited
to, music from a jukebox, radio, phonograph, shall not exceed sixty (60)
decibels in noise level as measured from the property line between the property
on which the outdoor premises is located and any adjoining property.
         g.   The artificial lighting of the outdoor premises shall be
sufficient to provide for the safety of all persons using such area but shall
not be such so as to create a nuisance or to inhibit the normal use and
enjoyment of surrounding property. Notwithstanding the foregoing, as measured
from any point, the artificial lighting shall not exceed one-tenth (0.1) foot-
candle either within or without the outdoor premises.
         h.   The entire operation and use of the outdoor premises shall be
carried on so as not to create a health or safety hazard or to create a
nuisance or to interfere with the use and enjoyment of surrounding property.
   F-2.   Class F.2 Outdoor License:
      1.   Retail Sale And Serving, Outdoor Premises: A Class F.2 license shall
authorize the sale at retail and serving of alcoholic liquor for consumption
only on the premises, except as otherwise permitted either by Section 6-28.8 or
by Section 6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act, provided such sale and
serving is accessory to the main purpose of the serving of meals on such
outdoor premises and not a vending machine operation.
      2.   Additional License Required: A Class F.2 license shall only be
issued to a holder of a current and valid Class B license.
      3.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail any alcoholic liquor for consumption on the outdoor premises
of sale in the Village except during the periods beginning with the permitted
commencement time and ending with the mandatory close time for the specified
day of the week, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Monday      11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Tuesday     11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Wednesday   11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Thursday    11:00 A.M.                      10:00 P.M.
Friday      11:00 A.M.                      11:00 P.M.
Saturday    9:00 A.M.                       11:00 P.M.
Sunday      9:00 A.M.                       10:00 P.M.
 
      4.   Fee: The fee for a Class F.2 license shall be as specified from time
to time in Section
1-10-7 of this Code.
      5.   Term: The effective period for any Class F.2 license shall be for
the license year; provided, however, that during the entire term that a Class
F.2 license is in effect, the holder of a Class F.2 license must, at all times
during such term, be the holder of a current and valid Class B license.
Accordingly, if, for any reason whatsoever, such Class B license is revoked,
suspended or terminated during the term of the Class F.2 license, the Class F.2
license, upon the revocation, suspension or termination of the Class B license
shall also be automatically and immediately revoked, suspended or terminated,
as the case may be, without any further action by the Village.
      6.   Definition: As used in this Subsection F.2, "outdoor premises" shall
mean:
         a.   An area used for Class F.2 operations immediately adjacent to the
main building for which the Class B license has been issued where alcoholic
liquor may be served pursuant to a Class F.2 license issued by the Village; and
         b.   Any point within such area shall not be more than one hundred
feet (100') from the main building on the Class B licensed premises.
         c.   No part of the outdoor premises shall include any parking lot or
parking area, nor shall such outdoor premises include any walkways going into
or coming out of the main building.
      7.   Additional Restrictions: The following shall be applicable with
respect to the outdoor premises:
         a.   The outdoor premises shall be owned or leased, and operated by
the same person to whom the respective Class B license has been issued.
         b.   At all times, the outdoor premises shall be used in conjunction
with the operation of the restaurant operation carried on in the main building.
         c.   The outdoor premises shall not block, in any way whatsoever, any
entrance to or exit from the said main building.
         d.   The outdoor premises shall be generally enclosed by barrier(s)
such as fencing, dense landscaping, and/or by the main building of the licensed
premises so as to discourage ingress to and egress from the area except through
designated entrances and exits.
         e.   The maximum number of persons allowed at any time in such outdoor
premises shall be one hundred fifty (150).
         f.   Live entertainment shall be permitted on the outdoor premises,
amplified to no more than sixty (60) decibels in noise level as measured from
the property line between the property on which the outdoor premises is located
and any adjoining property, except when specifically approved in advance by the
Village President and Board of Trustees. Any other type of entertainment
provided, such as, but not limited to, music from a jukebox, radio, phonograph,
shall also not exceed sixty (60) decibels in noise level as measured from the
property line between the property on which the outdoor premises is located and
any adjoining property.
         g.   The lighting of the outdoor premises shall be sufficient to
provide for the safety of all persons using such area but shall not be such so
as to create a nuisance or to inhibit the normal use and enjoyment of
surrounding property. Notwithstanding the foregoing, as measured from any
point, the artificial lighting shall not exceed one-tenth (0.1) foot-candle on
any property line of the licensed premises.
         h.   The entire operation and use of the outdoor premises shall be
carried on so as not to create a health or safety hazard or to create a
nuisance or to interfere with the use and enjoyment of surrounding property.
   G.   Class G License:

only, except as otherwise permitted either by Section 6-28.8 or by section 6-33
of the Illinois Liquor Control Act, but only subject to and in compliance with
the following conditions: provided that the principal purpose of and operation
of such facility is use as a snack bar and/or restaurant within and accessory
to a recreational and/or sports and fitness facility, provided that sales occur
only during hours when food is being served, excluding any food from vending
machines.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail and it shall be unlawful to serve alcoholic liquor for
consumption on the premises of sale in the Village except during the periods
beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending with the mandatory
close time for such day, as follows:

   I.   Class I License:
      1.   Brewpub: A Class I license shall authorize the sale at retail on the
premises for immediate delivery or by phone order, electronic mail, or regular
mail order for future delivery, of only beer and wine in the original package
container, but not for consumption on the premises.
      2.   Additional License Required: A Class I license shall only be issued
to a holder of a then valid Class B license.
      3.   Hours Of Sale: There shall be no mandatory closing time for the
holder of a Class I license, except that for sales on the premises for
immediate delivery shall be limited to those hours of sales applicable to a
Class B license.
      4.   Number Of Licenses: There is only one Class I license authorized.
      5.   Fee: The original fee for a Class I license shall be as specified
from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. The renewal fee for a Class I license shall be as
specified from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   J.   Class K License:
      1.    A Class K license is a special temporary liquor license for a
special event or special use where alcoholic liquor is consumed on the premises
and which will be held for community celebration, commemoration, memorial,
hospitality, fundraising, and/or for similar purposes, for a period of not to
exceed four (4) days except as otherwise approved by the Village President and
issued by the Village President acting as Local Liquor Control Commissioner
only to a) a qualifying organization, as such term is defined in Section
2-3-2, "Definitions, of this Chapter, b) the Village or another governmental
entity, c) a holder of a valid, current Lake Barrington, Illinois, Class B
(restaurant) or Class D (restaurant/wine and beer) liquor license, or d) a
holder of a similar valid, current liquor license for retail sale and
consumption of alcoholic liquor on the licensed premises from both the State of
Illinois and another local governmental entity.
      2.   Each application for a Class K special temporary liquor license for
an applicant other than the Village or another governmental entity shall
contain a copy of the applicant’s recorded Articles of Incorporation and a copy
of the applicant’s most recent annual report filed with the Secretary of State
of the State of Illinois. Notwithstanding the foregoing, each application
submitted by a qualifying organization shall include reasonable evidence of the
purpose and function that such qualifying organization is providing. All
applications shall state the time period for which the license shall be
applicable and shall state whether the license is for an outdoor or an indoor
location or some combination thereof.
      3.   Such a Class K special temporary liquor license shall authorize: a)
the sale, serving and consumption on the premises of alcoholic liquor at a
special event or special use or b) consumption of alcoholic liquor at a special
event that was not purchased on the licensed premises, which is otherwise known
as Bring Your Own Bottle ("BYOB") as defined in Section
2-3-2, "Definitions", of this Village Code but only if the applicant is the
Village or another governmental entity. Applicants for a Class K special
temporary liquor license must additionally comply with the provisions of
Subsection X.2. of Section
6-1-2 of this Code. The fee and related costs for such Class K special
temporary liquor license shall be as specified from time to time in Section
1-10-7 of this Code per day and as specified in Subsection X.2. of Section
6-1-2 of this Code, but no separate application fee shall be charged. An
applicant shall be required to obtain such a Class K special temporary license
for each and every such event it holds within the Village, and the number of
events held by any such qualifying organization other than the Village shall
not exceed six (6) such events in any calendar year. No such special license
shall be issued to any applicant other than to the Village until the Village
President has received evidence that the applicant shall have satisfactory
dramshop liability insurance coverage in effect during the period for which
each such special license shall be issued.
      4.   For an applicant other than the Village, before a special event or
special use authorized by a Class K special temporary liquor license may be
held and in order for a Class K special temporary liquor license from the
Village to become effective and valid, applicants other than the Village are
subject to and shall be required to obtain the following State approval(s) from
the Illinois Liquor Control Commission:
         a.   An applicant which is a qualifying organization, as such term is
defined in Section
2-3-2, "Definitions, of this Chapter, other than the Village, shall also be
required to apply to the State of Illinois for, pay the applicable fee for, and
obtain a "Special Event Retailer's Liquor License"; and
         b.   An applicant who is either i) a holder of a valid, current Lake
Barrington, Illinois, Class B (restaurant) or Class D (restaurant/wine and
beer) license or ii) a holder of a similar valid current liquor license for
retail sale and consumption on the licensed premises of alcoholic liquor from
both the State of Illinois and another local governmental entity, shall be
required to apply to the State of Illinois for, pay the applicable fee for, and
obtain a "Special Use Permit Liquor License".
   K.   Class L License: A Class L license allows within the area specifically
designated in the license as the premises, the immediate consumption of table
wine that was not purchased on the premises, subject to the following
conditions:
      1.   A Class L license shall only be issued to a holder of a valid,
current Lake Barrington, Illinois, Class B (restaurant), Class C (golf club),
Class D (restaurant/wine and beer) and/or Class F (outdoor restaurant) license
and only if such license(s) are still valid and in effect. Accordingly, if for
any reason whatsoever, during the term of the Class L license, any one of such
Class L licensee's license(s) required pursuant to this subsection is revoked,
suspended or terminated, then upon such revocation, suspension or termination,
as the case may be, the licensee's Class L license shall also be immediately
revoked, suspended or terminated, as the case may be, without any further
action of the Village; and
      2.   A Class L license shall only permit service and consumption within
the licensed premises during the times that alcoholic liquor may be served and
consumed pursuant to the regulations for the underlying license (i.e., the
Class B, C, D, and/or F license); and
      3.   A Class L license is only intended to and shall only permit the
consumption on the premises of table wine that is not purchased on the
premises, except as otherwise permitted either by Section 6-28.8 or by section
6-33 of the Illinois Liquor Control Act. The use of the term "alcoholic liquor"
or any other term or phrase of similar import with respect to a Class L license
is not intended to permit and shall not be construed to permit the consumption
on the premises of any kind of alcoholic liquor (other than table wine) that is
not purchased on the premises. The term "table wine" as used in reference to a
Class L license means any alcoholic beverage obtained by the fermentation of
the natural contents of fruits, or vegetables, containing sugar, including such
beverages when fortified by the addition of alcohol or spirits, as defined in
the Illinois Liquor Control Act; and
      4.   A Class L license holder may charge a reasonable fee for each bottle
of table wine that is provided by the customer and is served by the license
holder; and
      5.   A Class L license holder shall not advertise or otherwise promote
any of the activities permitted under the provisions of the Class L license;
and
      6.   Whether indoors, outdoors, or a combination thereof, the premises
upon which alcoholic liquor may be sold and served pursuant to a Class L
license shall be the same area as the premises as that term is defined in the
underlying Class B, C, D, and/or F license(s); and
      7.   All of the regulations, including, but not limited to, the
restricted hours of sale, set forth in this section applicable to a Class B, C,
D, and/or F license shall also apply to table wine, if any, served pursuant to
a Class L license; and
      8.   The original fee for a Class L license shall be as specified from
time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. The renewal fee for a Class L license shall be as
specified from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   L.   Class M License:
      1.   A Class M license allows the sale of alcoholic liquors for
consumption off the premises as an incidental part of food service; provided
that such sales are provided by a caterer and are limited to invited guests at
catered functions. A Class M license shall only be issued to a caterer who
conducts business from a location established within the boundaries of the
Village. For purposes of a Class M license, a "caterer" or terms of similar
import shall mean and refer to a business or activity, the purpose of which is
the processing, preparing and serving of meals or food items for consumption
off the premises where prepared and on the premises of a specific customer. At
all times, the Class M license holder shall comply with all of the provisions
of this chapter governing licenses and license holders. There shall be no limit
to the number of Class M licenses issued.
      2.   Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in this Code, the
annual liquor license fee for a caterer liquor license shall be as specified
from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   M.   Class N License:
      1.   Retail Sale, Beer And Wine: A Class N license shall authorize the
sale at retail in a gas station convenience store of only beer and/or wine in
the original package container but not for consumption on the premises of sale.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail any beer and wine in the original package not for
consumption on the premises of sale in the Village except on a day of the week
during the period beginning with the permitted commencement time and ending
with the mandatory close time for such day, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Monday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Tuesday     6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Wednesday   6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Thursday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Friday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Saturday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Sunday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
 
      3.   Employee Twenty One Years Of Age To Be Present: During the hours of
sale specified in subsection M2 of this section, at least one store employee of
twenty one (21) years of age or older must be present on the licensed premises.
      4.   Fee: The original fee for a Class N license shall be as specified
from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code. The renewal fee for a Class N license shall be as
specified from time to time in section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   N.   Class O License:
      1.   Retail Goods Establishments: In connection with a retail goods
establishment, a Class O license shall authorize the sale at retail and serving
of alcoholic liquor on the licensed premises for consumption only on the
licensed premises. A Class O license shall also be subject to the following
additional conditions:
         a.   Incidental to Business Operation: The sale and/or serving of
alcoholic liquor on the licensed premises shall be merely incidental to the
primary business operation of the licensed premises as a retail goods
establishment, and the licensed premises shall not be advertised or otherwise
held out to be a drinking establishment;
         b.   Employee Twenty-One Years of Age to be Present: During the hours
of sale specified in Subsection 2 of this Section, at least one (1) employee of
the respective licensed retail goods establishment twenty-one (21) years of age
or older must be present on the licensed premises;
         c.   Live Entertainment Prohibited: No live entertainment of any
nature shall be permitted on the licensed premises;
         d.   No Signs: No sign or any other external indicia shall be
permitted on the licensed premises or on the surrounding property that
indicates that alcoholic liquor is available for sale and/or serving at the
licensed premises;
         e.   No holder of a Class O liquor license shall sell alcoholic liquor
other than such as authorized by their Class O liquor license; and
         f.   In no case shall the sale, service, and/or consumption on the
licensed premises of alcoholic liquor take place outside of the normal business
hours of the licensed premises and, in any event, not outside of the hours for
liquor service as otherwise set forth in Subsection 2, "Hours of Sale", below.
      2.   Hours Of Sale: It shall be unlawful for any person to sell or offer
for sale at retail any alcoholic liquor for consumption on the licensed
premises of sale in the Village, except during the periods beginning with the
permitted commencement time and ending with the mandatory close time for the
specified day of the week, as follows:
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Day Of Week Permitted Commencement Time For Mandatory Close Time For Such Day
            Such Day Of Week                Of Week
Monday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Tuesday     6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Wednesday   6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Thursday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Friday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Saturday    6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
Sunday      6:00 A.M.                       12:00 midnight
 
      3.   Fee: The fee for a Class O license shall be as specified from time
to time in Section
1-10-7 of this Code.
   O.    Hours Of Sale:
      1.   Holidays And Other Events: Notwithstanding anything contained in
this section to the contrary, for any Village liquor license which authorizes
the sale at retail and/or the serving of alcoholic liquor on New Year's Day,
St. Patrick's Day, Memorial Day, the Fourth of July, Labor Day, Halloween, the
day before Thanksgiving Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day,
and Super Bowl Sunday, the mandatory closing hours shall be the same as
provided for by this section for Friday and Saturday mandatory closing times
for their respective license(s).
      2.   Temporary Modifications Of Hours Of Sale And/Or Service:
Notwithstanding anything provided in this Code to the contrary, the Village
President, acting as the Village of Lake Barrington Local Liquor Control
Commissioner, may in his or her sole discretion, temporarily extend any
mandatory closing time and/or temporarily allow an earlier commencement time
for the sale and/or serving of alcoholic liquor on behalf of any holder of a
current, valid Village liquor license, for a specific day or days and/or for a
specific time period of any length in order to reasonably accommodate the
economic interests of the affected licensee(s) while giving due consideration
to the public health and safety when the Village President determines that such
a temporary extension of the closing time(s) and/or a temporary earlier
commencement time for the sale and/or serving of alcoholic liquor is
appropriate to specific circumstances. Such extension by the Local Liquor
Control Commissioner shall be accomplished by a written order executed by the
Local Liquor Control Commissioner, and such written order may be communicated
by such means as may be reasonably expected to reach the affected licensee(s).
P.   Number and Classification of Liquor Licenses by Designated License Holder
and Address:
   1.   There shall be issued in the Village not more than two (2) Class A
Licenses; four (4) Class B Licenses; one (1) Class C License; one (1) Class D
License; the number of Class E licenses shall be unlimited as described in
Paragraph E of Section 2-3-6 of this Village Code; four (4) Class F Licenses;
one (1) Class F.2 License; two (2) Class G Licenses; zero (0) Class H Licenses;
one (1) Class I License; two (2) Class L Licenses; three (3) Class M Licenses;
one (1) Class N License; and zero (0) Class O Licenses; as set forth below:
